item.title: Not a small tweet, not a large blog. Medium.
item.description: Medium has played a big role throughout the tech world since their Welcome to Medium post on Aug 14, 2012. Unfortunately, I suspect one day Medium will cease to operate (or be acquired at a discount) due to a sluggish revenue model. But, if Medium does goes kaboom, what happens to that content? Will it all still be available online in some other form? If Medium gets acquired, who’ll really own the content?

item.title: Upspin part 1: My $HOME
item.description: Background For some time I imagined a world where all I’d need to access my data was something, be it a laptop, cellphone or embedded microchip, that would authenticate me and grant access to all data available to me. In this world I could bring said authentication anywhere, e.g., a library or Chiba City, and start accessing data with whatever tools available. Imagine a keyboard, mouse and monitor at the library or tablet at an airport.

item.title: Generate GPG key, add to GitHub and verify identity
item.description: But why? GPG signature verification A few gotchas. Make sure to verify the email addresses associated with your GPG key. Don’t forget to add said email(s) to your .gitconfig file. e.g., git config --global user.email "email@example.com" (global setting) Download GPG suite, which will enable adding key(s) to the macOS keychain. Before proceeding, please check for existing keys and make backups!!! To list keys in secret keyring run: gpg --list-secret-keys.
